name: infringe
content:

Add to word list
to break a rule, law, etc.: They infringed building regulations.

Add to word list
Add to word list
to act in a way that is against a law or that limits someone’s rights or freedom: [ T ] Copying videos infringes copyright law. [ I always + adv/prep ] The senator is opposed to any laws that infringe on a citizen’s right to free speech. infringement noun [ C/U ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ɪnˈfrɪndʒ·mənt/
[ U ] copyright/patent infringement
Add to word list
Add to word list
to do something that is against a law, an agreement, etc.: infringe a trademark/patent/copyright The computer giant filed papers claiming that the patent of their online software had been infringed. Phrasal verb
infringe on/upon sth
